content:
• Tuesday, December 11, 2018
  • HAIN

    After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: HAIN +5.9%. PVTL +4.7%. EAF +4.3%. AXNX +4.3%. URI +3.1%.
    • Losers: PLAY -14.7%. MRNS -8.8%. AEO -6.7%. FLDM -6.2%. LAND -4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • URI

    URI provides guidance, resumes buyback program; shares +3.1%

    • United Rentals (NYSE:URI) is up 3.1% in postmarket action following updates from its investor day, including resumption of a share repurchase program.
    • The company reaffirmed 2018 full-year guidance, for revenue of $7.89B-$7.99B (vs. consensus for $7.91B), EBITDA of $3.815B-$3.865B, cash from operations of $2.725B-$2.875B and free cash flow of $1.25B-$1.35B.
    • For 2019, it's guiding to revenue of $9.15B-$9.55B (above consensus for $8.93B), EBITDA of $4.35B-$4.55B, cash from operations of $2.85B-$3.2B, and free cash flow of $1.3B-$1.5B.
    • It's resuming a $1.25B repurchase program that it paused on Nov. 1, to focus on integrating its acquisition of BlueLine. About $210M worth of shares were bought on the program through Sept. 30; the company intends to wrap up the full program by the end of 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 5 Comments
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial +5.9% on setting committee for strategic alternatives

    • Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN) is up 5.9% after hours following an SEC filing showing it's formalized a Strategy Committee to evaluate strategic alternatives.
    • The filing also notes the company approved appointing R. Dean Hollis as chairman (effective Dec. 5) and shifted composition of other committees, including the Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, and Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.
    • Previously: Hain Celestial settles with the SEC (Dec. 11 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 10 Comments
  • SIFI

    Berkshire Hills to acquire SI Financial Group in $180M stock deal

    • SI Financial Group (NASDAQ:SIFI) gains 7.4% to $14.00 in after-hours trading after it agreed to be acquired by Berkshire Hills Bancorp (NASDAQ:BHLB) in an all-stock transaction valued at $180M.
    • Berkshire will exchange 0.48 shares of BHLB for each SIFI share; values SIFI at about $15.00 per based on Dec. 10 close.
    • Deal is expected to add 5% to Berkshire Hills 2020 EPS, the first full year of integrated operations.
    • Targets cost savings of 30%.
    • Tangible book value dilution of 53 cents per share, or 2.4%, with an expected less than 3-year earn-back period.
    • SIFI reported $1.3B in loans and $1.3B in deposits as of Sept. 30, 2018.
    • BHLB +0.2%.
    • Previously: Berkshire Hills Bancorp CEO steps down (Nov. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • ANGI

    ANGI -1.6% on secondary offering

    • ANGI Homeservices (NASDAQ:ANGI) announces a secondary public offering of 1,504,082 shares of Class A common stock.
    • The selling shareholders received the offered shares in ANGI's October acquisition of Handy Technologies. ANGI will not receive any proceeds from the sale.
    • ANGI shares are down 1.6% after hours to $16.35.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVTL

    Pivotal Software +2.5% on Q3 beats, upside guide

    • Pivotal Software (NYSE:PVTL) gains 2.5% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat estimates with 30% Y/Y revenue growth. Q4 guidance has upside revenue from $169M to $171M (consensus: $167.29M) with subscription revenue of $109.5M to $110.5M and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.09 (consensus: -$0.10).
    • Q3 subscription revenue was $100.8M, +53% Y/Y. Subscription customers grew to 368, +17% Y/Y.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Pivotal Software beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Dec. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters slips on light guidance

    • American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) is down slightly after posting a mixed Q3 report.
    • Comparable sales were up 8% during the quarter vs. +8.4% consensus.
    • AE total brand comparable sales rose an in-line +5%, while Aerie total brand comparable sales jumped 32% vs. +29% consensus.
    • Investors may have their eyes on AEO's profit guidance for Q4.  The retailer expects EPS of $0.40 to $0.42 for the busy holiday quarter vs. $0.45 consensus.
    • AEO -1.68% AH to $18.69.
    • Previously: American Eagle Outfitters beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Dec. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • PVTL

    Pivotal Software beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Pivotal Software (NYSE:PVTL): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.03; GAAP EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $168.14M (+30.4% Y/Y) beats by $4.03M.
    • Shares +1.12%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • PLAY

    Dave & Buster's slides after comp miss

    • Dave & Buster's Entertainment (NASDAQ:PLAY) reports comparable sales fell 1.3% in Q3 vs. -0.7% consensus.
    • Food and Beverage revenues increased 10.3% during the quarter to $118.8M, while amusement/other revenue was up 14.8% to $163.3M.
    • Adjusted EBITDA fell 2.7% to $52.7M during the quarter.
    • The company sees FY19 revenue of $1.243B to $1.255 bln vs $1.250B. consensus. "With the 2017 class of stores on track to generate one of our best cash-on-cash returns in recent history, we are more confident than ever in our ability to drive double-digit unit growth and benefit from the large opportunity ahead,” says D&B CEO  Brian Jenkins.
    • PLAY -7.93% AH to $47.00.
    • Previously: Dave & Buster's beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Dec. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • MRNS

    Marinus Pharma launches 12M-share stock offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • Marinus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MRNS) is down 7% after hours in reaction to its planned public offering of 12M common shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 20 Comments
  • LAND

    Gladstone Land -3.6% after announcing stock offering

    • Gladstone Land (NASDAQ:LAND) sinks 3.6% in after-hours trading after the REIT announces plans to sell an unspecified number of shares.
    • Plans to use net proceeds to repay existing indebtedness, which will be used to fund future property acquisitions, and for other general corporate purposes.
    • Offering to be conducted under effective shelf registration statement.
    • Previously: Gladstone Land acquires almond orchard in California (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 21 Comments
  • FLDM

    Fluidigm readies stock offering; shares down 8% after hours

    • Fluidigm (NASDAQ:FLDM) launches a stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 8% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM

  • British pound sinks to 20-month low as Brexit hangs in balance

    • The British pound sinks 0.6% against the U.S. dollar as U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May meets with EU leaders on a whistle-stop tour who tell her they'll stand pat on the current Brexit agreement.
    • She's also facing a potential no-confidence vote as an increasing number of Tories are trying to oust her.
    • The pound is trading at $1.249, just off its session low of $1.2483, which is also its low for the year.
    • May is trying to sell the agreement to a hostile Parliament.
    • The EU leaders are open to providing assurances over the backstop agreement that aims to prevent a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland. However, they won't reopen negotiation and they won't make the backstop temporary, Bloomberg reports.
    • Previously: Juncker: 'No room to renegotiate Brexit deal' (Dec. 11)
    • ETFs: FXB, EWU, GBB, DBUK, FKU, DXPS, HEWU, QGBR, DGBP, FLGB, UGBP
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • SLB

    Oilfield servicers including Schlumberger, Core Labs lowered at J.P. Morgan

    • Most oilfield services stocks are lower after J.P. Morgan downgrades several names, including Schlumberger (SLB -2%), Core Labs (CLB -4.5%) and Weatherford (WFT -4.7%) to Neutral from Overweight, as the firm moderates the pace of U.S. activity in its earnings models for 2019.
    • The firm believes it will be difficult to envision a reversal in SLB without a material change in offshore fundamentals; SLB price target is cut to $48 from $73.
    • CLB's "elevated multiples" predicated on a long cycle recovery are more at risk going forward, JPM says, slashing its price target to $79 from $111.
    • WFT is downgraded without a price target, as JPM continues to see a "narrow path" to the company's turnaround efforts to stave off a restructuring event.
    • The firm downgrades Superior Energy (SPN -3.9%) to Underweight from Neutral without a price target, saying while near-term cash flow is possible, the company's long-term solutions are "more challenging without a better macro."
    • But Nabors Industries (NBR +2.7%) trades higher despite JPM's downgrade to Underweight without a PT, seeing the company's elevated balance sheet, international cash margins "that cannot find a bottom" and its "persistent inability" to generate free cash flow as challenges for the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 31 Comments
  • CSCO

    Cisco +1.4% on Luxtera bid report

    • Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) is in talks to buy optical chipmaker Luxtera, according to Bloomberg sources.
    • A fixed price hasn't been determined yet, but the deal could be valued in the "hundreds of millions of dollars."
    • Cisco's bid reportedly beat out interest from Intel and Broadcom.
    • Cisco shares are up 1.4% to $47.52.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 8 Comments
  • CORT

    Corcept Therapeutics up 26% on new Korlym patent

    • Corcept Therapeutics (CORT +25.6%) is up on almost a 5x surge in volume in response to a reported new U.S. patent covering Korlym (mifepristone). The investors are reacting bullishly since a new patent strengthens its position against would-be generic competitors, including Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA +0.8%), who has already filed an ANDA and is challenging the validity of two other U.S. patents covering the cortisol receptor blocker. Korlym currently accounts for all of Corcept's sales.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Update: The patent covers the concomitant use of Korlym and CYP3A inhibitors to treat patients with Cushing's syndrome. It will expire in 2037.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • GS

    Bank stocks decline is oversold, says Deutsche Bank

    • With few signs of a significant economic slowdown in the next six to nine months, Deutsche Bank analyst Matt O'Connor sees bank stocks as oversold.
    • Bank stocks' bear market has persisted for about 45 weeks, declining 22% from Feb. 1 highs and is the fifth-longest bear market going back to 1966, he writes.
    • Most positive on brokers, such as Goldman Sachs (GS -0.1%) and Morgan Stanley (MS +1.1%) and lower-multiple regional banks, with Citizens Financial Group (CFG +0.1%) his top pick; flags "market sensitive" banks--Bank of America (BAC +0.7%), Citi (C -0.4%), Goldman, JPMorgan (JPM +0.2%), and MS.
    • Goldman's $5B+ growth efforts, FICC turnaround, healthy investment bank fees, strength in equity I&L provide upside.
    • Previously: Morgan Stanley sees slower loan growth for midcap banks (Dec. 11)
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, KRE, VFH, KBE, UYG, FNCL, IYF, BTO, IAT, IYG, KBWB, RYF, QABA, KBWR, FXO, SEF-OLD, FINU, DPST, FINZ, WDRW, JHMF, FTXO, XF
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 64 Comments
  • WISA

    HIMX, GOGO, and CAMP among tech movers

    • Gainers: Summit Wireless Technologies (WISA) +19%. Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) +12%. Quantum (NYSE:QTM-OLD) +13%. Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) +11%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +11%.
    • Losers: SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC) -22%. CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP) -15%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -14%. Sonic Foundry (OTC:SOFO) -12%. Safe-T Group (NASDAQ:SFET) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AVH

    Avianca Brasil plummets after bankruptcy filing

    • Shares of Avianca Brasil are down more than 20% in Sao Paulo after the company filed for bankruptcy protection. Avianca Holdings (NYSE:AVH), which is by owned by the same holding company as the Brazilian airline, is down 2.2% but off its session low.
    • Avianca Brasil has piled up several consecutive years of losses before making the filing.
    • Avianca Brasil is currently sitting as the fourth largest airline in Brazil.
    • Sector watch: Gol Linhas (GOL +12.9%) and Azul (AZUL +7.4%) are holding on to their large gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • GE

    GE sinks to $6.66/share, lowest since financial crisis

    • General Electric (GE -2.1%) shares fall as low as $6.66 intraday, a level equal to the lowest close for the stock during the financial crisis a decade ago.
    • GE has now fallen ~61% YTD, including 21% in the past month alone.
    • For comparison's sake, Tesla is now worth $4B more than GE, Bespoke notes.
    • Earlier: UBS stays bullish on GE, sees 'plenty of levers' to reduce leverage (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 189 Comments
  • DTEGY

    Vodafone, Liberty confident as EU opens full deal review

    • The European Union opened a full investigation of the $21.8B asset deal between Liberty Global (LBTYA -2%) and Vodafone (VOD +0.5%), saying Vodafone's purchases could damage competition in Germany and the Czech Republic.
    • The deal is set to let Vodafone take a tougher fight to Telefonica Deutschland (TEF -0.1%) and Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY).
    • But the arrangement could shut some rivals out in the Czech market, the EC says, while Germany could see not only less competition in retail fixed telecom and retail TV, but the deal could also give the merged firm more power as a broadcaster and cut network investment.
    • Meanwhile, both Liberty Global and Vodafone see the deal tracking toward approval by the middle of 2019.
    • The EC saw no issues in Romania and Hungary, and plans to decide on the deal by May 2 (which could be extended if Vodafone offers concessions).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • SFTBF

    Nvidia -2% on SoftBank stake sale headlines (update)

    • SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF, OTCPK:SFTBY) is planning a sale of its Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) stake early next year, according to Bloomberg.
    • SoftBank could book a profit of $3B from the sale.
    • Update: Bloomberg reports that no final decision has been made and SoftBank could decide to keep its stake or only sell a portion.
    • SoftBank holds an equity stake in Nvidia and has constructed a $6B collar trade, which allows investors to collect stakes with protection from share price declines. Nvidia shares are down 48% from their early October peak.
    • The sale opportunity would come in tranches that begin to expire in early 2019 with the average price of options between $230 and $240 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 45 Comments
  • SNMP

    Sanchez Midstream Partners and Altus Midstream among Energy/Materials gainers; Superior Drilling Products and NCS Multistage among losers

    • Gainers: Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) +13%. Altus Midstream (NASDAQ:ALTM) +9%. Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) +7%.
    • Losers: Superior Drilling Products (NYSEMKT:SDPI) -15%. NCS Multistage (NASDAQ:NCSM) -11%. Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) -11%. Arcadia Biosciences (NASDAQ:RKDA) -10%. Ingevity (NYSE:NGVT) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOL

    Avianca bankruptcy report creates a ripple

    • There's quite a bit of volatility in the Latin American airline sector after Avianca Brasil reportedly files for bankruptcy protection in Brazil. Local media is saying the filing was made in a Sao Paulo court yesterday.
    • Investors are bidding up Gol Linhas (GOL +10.1%) and Azul (AZUL +6.3%) off the development. LATAM Airlines (LTM +4.8%) and Copa Holdings (CPA +2%) are also taking flight.
    • Update: Bloomberg is reporting that the filing was actually made by Oceanair, a separate company controlled by Avianca's largest shareholder.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 16 Comments
  • NOVN

    Novan up 21% ahead of early-stage SB414 data

    • Thinly traded nano cap Novan (NOVN +21.4%) is up on over triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 146K shares, ahead of a presentation of Phase 1b data on topical cream SB414 for atopic dermatitis at the 3rd Inflammatory Skin Disease Summit in Vienna, Austria.
    • Shares jumped temporarily in August after the company announced preliminary data from the same study.
    • A Phase 2 trial is next up.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September, it had $12.2M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $24.9M across the first three quarters of the year.
    • Previously: Novan up 22% premarket on encouraging performance of SB414 2% (Aug. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • TME

    Tencent Music guiding $1.2B IPO to midpoint pricing

    • Books have closed in New York around the U.S. initial public offering for Tencent Music (NYSE:TME), and the company is expecting pricing around the midpoint of its range, it tells investors.
    • That would bring the company public at $14 per American depositary share, Bloomberg notes.
    • It expects to price the offering after the market close today.
    • The company, spinning out from Tencent (TCEHY +2.1%), is offering 82M ADS and hopes to raise as much as $1.2B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • NMRK

    Newmark Group leads financial gainers; LM Funding America and LexinFintech Holdings among losers

    • Gainers: Newmark Group (NASDAQ:NMRK) +9%. Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +6%.
    • Losers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -15%. Live Oak Bancshares (NASDAQ:LOB) -11%. LexinFintech Holdings (NASDAQ:LX) -10%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) -7%. LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 8 Comments
  • QDEL

    Bargain hunters move into Quidel after Beckman-stoked selloff; shares up 4%

    • Thinly traded Quidel (QDEL +3.9%) is up on 30% higher volume as bargain hunters take advantage of a selloff following an adverse court ruling allowing Beckman to directly sell a certain diagnostic test that accounts for a sizeable of portion of revenues. Shares initially dropped over 27% before recovering.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • MYOS

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: MYOS RENS Technology (NASDAQ:MYOS) +58%. Draper Oakwood Technology (NASDAQ:DOTA) +58%. Moleculin Biotech (NASDAQ:MBRX) +24%. Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA) +19%. Novan (NASDAQ:NOVN) +18%. AAC Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:AAC) +16%. Imprimis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IMMY-OLD) +15%. Pyxis Tankers (NASDAQ:PXS) +14%. MiMedx Group (OTC:MDXG) +14%. New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) +14%.
    • Losers: Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX) -28%. SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC) -24%. Destination Maternity (NASDAQ:DEST) -20%. Evolus (NASDAQ:EOLS) -17%. American Electric Technologies (NASDAQ:AETI) -17%. CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP) -16%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -15%. Superior Drilling Products (NYSEMKT:SDPI) -15%. Quanex Building Products (NYSE:NX) -15%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing's 737 November deliveries suggest supplier problems clearing up

    • Boeing (BA -1.4%) says it delivered 61 of its 737 single-aisle aircraft in November, up from 50 a year ago, suggesting the company may be overcoming production bottlenecks stemming from delays in the delivery of fuselages and engines from its suppliers.
    • Boeing says total YTD deliveries rose to 704 from 680 in the same 11-month period last year, and has said to expects to deliver 810-815 planes in 2018; the company delivered a total of 79 aircraft in November.
    • Deliveries could take a hit if Indonesia's Lion Air decides to cancel orders for 737 MAX jets following the October crash that killed 189 passengers; Lion Air has 190 Boeing jets worth $22B at list prices waiting to be delivered on top of 197 already taken, making it one of Boeing's biggest export customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 12 Comments
  • GOGO

    Gogo +10% as it reports de-icing modifications working

    • Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) is up 10% after seeing positive results from modifications it made to protect against contamination from aircraft de-icing fluid.
    • Aircraft that had modifications to 2Ku connectivity installations didn't see any system degradation as of yesterday, Gogo says. Some 600 aircraft have seen the modifications, about 95% of Gogo's fleet.
    • The company estimates that aircraft with the de-icing modifications have been de-iced before 2,601 flights this winter.
    • Gogo says it's responding to investor inquiries around significant winter storm activity, including last weekend's storm Diego.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 3 Comments

  • Tech lunch: Seeing green on trade optimism

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) +0.7% goes green today as US-China trade war sentiment leans more positive, which gave a large boost to semis with the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index up 1.1%. The lighter news day has included Dell receiving shareholder approval for its tracking stock buyout and Google CEO Sundar Pichai testifying before a House committee.
    • The S&P 500 IT Index is up 0.4% and the Nasdaq 100 gains 0.6% compared to the 0.04%, 0.2%, and 0.5% for the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, respectively.
    • Related semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
    • Previously: Dell shareholders approve tracking stock buyout (Dec. 11)
    • Previously: Google CEO testifies for House committee (updates) (Dec. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • NBEV

    New Age Beverages leads consumer gainers; Energous among losers

    • Gainers: New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) +14%. TreeHouse Foods (NYSE:THS) +8%. China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS) +8%. At Home Group (NASDAQ:HOME) +7%.
    • Losers: Naked Brand Group (NASDAQ:NAKD) -10%. Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) -8%. CCA Industries (NYSEMKT:CAW) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARMK

    Aramark plunges 11% in disappointing guidance

    • Holding its Investor Day, Aramark (ARMK -11.1%) expects FY19 adjusted EPS of $2.27-$2.37 vs. Street estimates of $2.50.
    • Organic revenue growth is seen at 2-4%. Free cash flow is expected to be about $500M.
    • Webcast and presentation slides
    • Goldman bull Stephen Grambling says market reaction is overdone, noting the stock was already trading at a cheap valuation.
    • He reminds some accounting changes are making the EPS miss look worse than it is. He continues to rate the stock a Buy, but may trim estimates based on today's information.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AMD

    Cowen: AMD a top pick for 2019

    • Cowen analyst Matthew Ramsay names AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) as one of the firm's best ideas for 2019 citing the move to 7nm.
    • Ramsay says the refresh will signify AMD's "first manufacturing advantage over Intel (NASDAQ:INTC)" and continue executing the company's "strategic vision."
    • The analyst notes that 1H19 will have a "difficult set-up" on the end of the crypto mining boom, but that headwind won't stop AMD from picking up business in other areas.
    • AMD shares are up 0.9% to $20.18.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 45 Comments

  • Indian rupee strengthens after Das named central bank governor

    • Indian rupee gains 0.3% against the U.S. dollar after Shaktikanta Das is named governor of the Reserve Bank of India, a day after Urjit Patel stepped down from the post amid tension with the government.
    • iShares MSCI India Index ETF (BATS:INDA) +2.9% after falling 4.3% on Monday.
    • Das is appointed for a three-year term. He is a former secretary at the Department of Economic Affairs and is a member of the Finance Commission, which allocates tax revenue between the central government and states.
    • Previously: RBI, India state vote outcome in focus (Dec. 11)
    • ETFs: EPI, INDA, INDY, INDL, PIN, INXX, IIF, INP, INR, NFTY
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal wants extended European caps on steel imports

    • ArcelorMittal (MT +1.5%) says it is "absolutely critical" that Europe protect itself with measures to restrict imports of steel and remedy weaknesses in its existing system.
    • The European Union imposed provisional safeguards in July combining quotas and tariffs to counter steel flooding into the market after Pres. Trump hit U.S. steel imports with 25% tariffs; the provisional measures are in place for 200 days, meaning they would expire in early February unless they are replaced by a longer-term system.
    • MT says the weaknesses include exemptions for developing countries, which for example has allowed Turkey to export more steel to Europe, as well as the exemption for tonnage of steel already on ships.
    • The steelmaker sees the industry's ultimate problem as overcapacity in China: "It begins with China and ends with China," CEO Aditya Mittal tells a company presentation in Paris. "China created tremendous global overcapacity and subsidized its steel business and sought to solve that problem by exporting around the world."
    • Also, MT says Europe's demand for construction steel is down nearly 20% from its pre-financial crisis peak, with the market still coping with excess capacity.
    • ETF: SLX
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • VSM

    Versum Materials -6% after Goldman cuts to Sell

    • Versum Materials (VSM -5.8%) plunges to a 52-week low after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell from Neutral with a $26 price target, cut from $31, believing the market is underestimating the extent to which weaker semiconductor capital spending could hurt VSM's Delivery Systems and Services segment.
    • Goldman analyst Toshiya Hari says he remains constructive on the broad Semiconductor Materials sub-sector, but following meetings with companies in Asia last week he cuts his 2019 semiconductor capex outlook to down 13% Y/Y from down 6% previously, and sees downside risk to VSM's consensus estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos may give 50% return in 2018

    • Kratos (NASDAQ:KTOS) is up another 2.4% to $14.92 per share this morning after several sessions of big gains.
    • Last week, Dealreporter highlighted speculation that someone in the defense industry might be moving to acquire the company and its burgeoning drones business. That news prompted analysts at Canaccord Genuity to reiterate a price target of $16 on the Buy-rated stock.
    • Goldman Sachs also jumped on the bandwagon yesterday, upgrading Kratos to Buy and hiking its target price from $13 to $20.
    • If Kratos can add another $1.50 on to its share price by the end of the year, the stock will be up 50% in 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 9 Comments
  • MYOS

    Conatus Pharmaceuticals and Moleculin Biotech among healthcare gainers; Acorda Therapeutics leads the losers

  • Crude oil claws back some of yesterday's hefty losses; WTI +2.4%

    • Crude oil prices bounce nicely from yesterday’s losses, helped by gains in global stocks, a slightly weaker dollar and an outage hurting Libyan production; WTI +2.4% to $52.24/bbl, Brent +1.5% to $60.90/bbl.
    • Russia says it will cut oil output by 50K-60K bbl/day in January while gradually building to an agreed cut of 220K bbl/day, but some analysts think the cut may not be enough to restore balance to the market.
    • “There remains a lot of uncertainty if the production cut is thick enough to make a significant dent in global supply,” says Stephen Innes, head of trading for Asia-Pacific at futures brokerage Oanda in Singapore.
    • However, BofA Merrill Lynch thinks the OPEC+ cuts were sufficient and expects Brent crude to regain its recent losses in 2019 and settle at $70/bbl, predicting a "relatively balanced oil market" and stable inventories next year.
    • "Volatility will be high in the near future, but going into 2019, we are constructive on oil prices," says Hootan Yazhari, BAML's head of global frontier markets equity research.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI

  • FOX

    Report: Disney looks to sell regional sports nets piecemeal

    • Disney (DIS +1.2%) is increasingly likely to sell off the 22 regional sports networks it's getting from Fox (FOX +0.4%, FOXA +0.2%) in pieces rather than to a single buyer, the New York Post reports.
    • That's due to the complications arising in the sale, according to the report. A single deal would be simpler, but Disney is seeking a solid overall price on a package of deals it must complete within 90 days of closing the $71.3B Fox asset transaction.
    • The only known serious party to make a single bid for all the RSNs is Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +2.6%)/CVC Capital, but the Post says that was a lowball bid. Meanwhile, Apollo (APO +3%) and Nexstar (NXST +4.7%) have bid for almost all the networks -- but Apollo needs a partner, and Nexstar is likely less serious after agreeing to pay $6B for Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO).
    • Still out there for some slice of the RSNs: Charter (CHTR +0.9%), Minnesota Twins owner Jim Pohlad, Major League Baseball, the New York Yankees (for YES Network), Amazon.com (AMZN +0.4%), Blackstone (BX +2.9%), and Tegna (TGNA +3.2%), among others.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 6 Comments

  • MITK

    Mitek responds to ASG's offer boost

    • Mitek (NASDAQ:MITK) responds to yesterday's news that ASG had increased its buyout offer to $11.50 per share in cash, up from $10/share.
    • The company confirms the increased offer and says it met with ASG, found that the new price still undervalued the company, but gave ASG the chance to increase its offer again if ASG and Elliott agreed to a confidentiality agreement while due diligence was performed.
    • Key quote: "What we could not agree with was ASG’s and Elliott’s insistence on maintaining the ability over the next few months to threaten a proxy fight and otherwise pursue a hostile campaign against the Company – even after potentially receiving confidential information.   • MYOK

    MyoKardia down 1% premarket on early-stage MYK-491 data

    • Thinly traded MyoKardia (NASDAQ:MYOK) slips 1% premarket on light volume following its announcement of topline data from a Phase 1b single-ascending dose study evaluating MYK-491 in eight patients with stable heart failure.
    • Treatment with MYK-491 resulted in about a 10% increase from baseline in cardiac contractility across multiple measures.
    • On the safety front, no serious or life-threatening adverse events were observed.
    • A Phase 2 study is next up.
    • MYK-491, being co-developed with Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY), is an orally available small molecule allosteric activator of myosin designed to increase cardiac contractility in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy, a condition affecting ~1M Americans.

  • NVCN

    Neovasc up 27% premarket on positive long-term Reducer data

    • Nano cap Neovasc (NASDAQ:NVCN) is up 27% premarket on light volume in reaction to its announcement of positive 12-year follow-up data on the Neovasc Reducer in patients with severe angina pectoris. The results were just published in the Journal of the American College of Cardiology.
    • At year 12, all seven patients implanted with the Reducer in 2005 reported sustained improvements in angina class versus baseline. There were no signs of strut fractures, dislocation, thrombosis or migration.
    • The Reducer, a device deployed like a stent, provides relief from angina symptoms by altering the blood flow in the heart's circulatory system, increasing the perfusion of oxygenated blood to ischemic (inadequate blood flow) areas of cardiac muscle. It is currently CE Mark certified.
    • Previously: Neovasc up 18% premarket on positive Reducer data (Oct. 3)
